item.title: Testimony of Truth
item.description: The Lord entrusts a testimony of truth with those who share it with others. Members should be willing to share the gospel whenever they feel moved by the spirit.

item.title: Pride Keeps Us from Choosing the Lord
item.description: (D&C 39:7-12) President Benson warns that pride keeps us from choosing the Lord.

item.title: Emma Smith Follows the Lord's Counsel
item.description: (D&C 25) Emma Smith follows the counsel of the Lord.

item.title: "An Elect Lady"
item.description: (D&C 25:2-3) Video portraying events in the life of Emma Smith.

item.title: Organization of the Church
item.description: (D&C 20) The Church of Jesus Christ is restored to the earth in 1830.

item.title: The Worth of Souls
item.description: (D&C 18:10-16) President Thomas S. Monson The Worth of Souls.

item.title: Endure to the End
item.description: (D&C 14:7) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches how to endure to the end.

item.title: Restoration of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: (D&C 13) Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery receive the Aaronic Priesthood by the hand of John the Baptist.

item.title: Our Work Is to Keep the Commandments
item.description: (D&C 11: 12-14) Elder David A. Bednar teaches how our work is to keep the commandments.

item.title: Thwarting Satan's Evil Designs
item.description: (D&C 10:20-27) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin teaches the importance of thwarting Satan's evil designs.

item.title: Proceed with Trust
item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott teaches the importance of proceeding with trust (D&C 9:7-9).

item.title: Getting Answers to Prayers
item.description: (D&C 8-9) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches how to get answers to prayers.

item.title: Our Most Important Duty
item.description: (D&C 6:14-24) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland teaches about Our most important duty.

item.title: "This is the Spirit of Revelation"
item.description: (D&C 6,8-9) The early experiences of Oliver Cowdery serve as a case study to help students understand principles of personal revelation.

item.title: Missionaries to Match Our Message
item.description: (D&C 4) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains how we need missionaries to match Our message.

item.title: The Work of God
item.description: (D&C 3,10) Martin Harris tells a young man the story of the lost manuscript, emphasizing that the works, designs and purposes of God cannot be frustrated.

item.title: The True and Living Church
item.description: (D&C 1:30) President Henry B. Eyring teaches about the True and Living Church.

item.title: Seek the Lord
item.description: (D&C 1:14-16) A video showing the challenging choices that are placed before all people.

item.title: Joseph Smith and the Minister
item.description: (JS-H 1:21-26) Joseph Smith recounts his vision to a local minister.

item.title: The Great Apostasy
item.description: Wilford Woodruff's search for the true Church explains the Apostasy and need for the Restoration. It emphasizes four essential elements of the true Church that were lost because of the Great Apostasy.

item.title: The Plan of Salvation
item.description: Heavenly Father's plan of salvation is compared to a three-act play, showing that knowledge of the plan helps us in our everyday lives.

item.title: Overview of Church History
item.description: This video gives a brief introduction to the different time periods of Church history.

item.title: Testimony of Truth
item.description: The Lord entrusts a testimony of truth with those who share it with others. Members should be willing to share the gospel whenever they feel moved by the spirit.

item.title: If We Teach by the Spirit
item.description: By teaching and listening by the spirit, all are edified and strengthened, individually and collectively.

item.title: "An Eye Single to the Glory of God"
item.description: (D&C 82:19) Elder Nelson compares our perspective and the Lord's to a pair of binoculars.

item.title: Our Work Is to Go About Doing Good
item.description: (D&C 81:4-6) President Hinckley teaches that our work is to go about doing good.

item.title: The Church to Fill the Earth
item.description: (D&C 65) President Hinckley reviews the prophecy of how the Church will fill the earth.

item.title: The Heart and a Willing Mind
item.description: (D&C 64:34) Elder Heber C. Kimball and his family willingly serve the Lord as Elder Kimball leaves first from Kirtland and then from Nauvoo to preach the gospel in England.

item.title: Those Tithed Not Burned at His Coming
item.description: (D&C 64:23-25) President Hinckley teaches that those tithed will not be burned at His coming.

item.title: "Upon My Holy Day"
item.description: (D&C 59:9-12) Elder Holland pleads with youth to keep the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: A Man without Eloquence
item.description: (D&C 50:17-22) The testimony of a humble teacher helps Brigham Young become converted to the restored gospel.

item.title: Baptism of the Holy Ghost
item.description: (D&C 49:11-14) Elder Bednar teaches about the baptism of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: They that are Wise
item.description: (D&C 45:56-57) This video depicts the parable of the ten virgins, through which the Savior helps the disciples understand why and how to prepare for His Second Coming. Also included are examples of latter-day youth as they trim their spiritual lamps.

item.title: Be Not Troubled
item.description: (D&C 45:16-39) The Savior's parable of the fig tree teaches that we need not be frightened or troubled by the calamities that will come in the last days .

item.title: To "Act in All Holiness"
item.description: (D&C 43: 8-9,16) President Uchtdorf teaches how to "act in all holiness."

item.title: Trial of Your Faith
item.description: Quote given by Elder Neil L. Andersen in the Saturday afternoon session on October 6, 2012.

item.title: We Must Forgive
item.description: The experience of Corrie ten Boom illustrates how we can feel the love of God when we forgive.

item.title: Latter-day Martyrs
item.description: James E. Faust relates the circumstances surrounding the martyrdom of Rafael Monroy and Vicente Morales.

item.title: The Savor of Men
item.description: When the Lord used the expression ‘savor of men,’ He was speaking of those who represent Him.

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: President Monson talks on blessings of obedience. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Light and Truth, Part 1
item.description: This video examines God's attributes of light and truth as explained in section 88 of the Doctrine and Covenants (D&C 88:6-13).

item.title: The Spirit and the Body
item.description: President Packer teaches about the spirit and the body (D&C 88:14-17).

item.title: Those Warned Must Warn Others
item.description: President Eyring explains those warned must warn others (D&C 88:81-82).

item.title: School of the Prophets
item.description: President Hinckley teaches about the School of the Prophets (D&C 88:117-137).

item.title: Wisdom against Conspiring Men
item.description: President Packer gives wisdom against conspiring men (D&C 89:1-4).

item.title: Great Treasures of Knowledge
item.description: President Packer teaches about great treasures of knowledge (D&C 89:18-21).

item.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
item.description: President Packer teaches about the keys of the kingdom (D&C 90:1-5).

item.title: Light and Truth, Part 2
item.description: This video examines God's attributes of light and truth as explained in section 88 of the Doctrine and Covenants (D&C 93:28,36-40).

item.title: We Must Keep Temples Sacred
item.description: President Hinckley admonishes that we must keep temples sacred (D&C 97:10-17).

item.title: Afflictions Can Be For Our Good
item.description: (D&C 98:1-3,11-22) Elder Oaks teaches that afflictions can be for our good.

item.title: Proclaim Peace
item.description: Elder Nelson counsels us to proclaim peace (D&C 98:16-18,23-48).

item.title: The Lord Tests His People
item.description: President Faust teaches that the Lord tests His people (D&C 101:1-19).

item.title: Gather in Stakes
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to gather in stakes (D&C 101:20-22,63-75).

item.title: God Raised Up Wise Men to Establish the Constitution
item.description: President Benson teaches that God raised up wise men to establish the U.S. Constitution (D&C 101:76-80,93-95).

item.title: The Church is Governed through Councils
item.description: Elder Ballard teaches the Church is governed through councils (D&C 102:1-11).

item.title: Disciplinary Councils
item.description: President Hinckley teaches about disciplinary Councils (D&C 102:9-33).

item.title: Pay Off Debts as Quickly as You Can
item.description: President Hinckley counsels us to pay off debts as quickly as possible (D&C 104:78-83).

item.title: Zion's Camp
item.description: (D&C 105) Several events from the march of Zion's Camp show how it fulfilled the purposes of God.

item.title: Succession in the Presidency
item.description: Elder Haight teaches about succession in the Presidency (D&C 107:21-38).

item.title: Learn and Do Your Duty
item.description: President Monson counsels to learn and do your duty (D&C 107:99-100).

item.title: Windows of Heaven Open to Obedient
item.description: Elder Wirthlin teaches the windows of Heaven are open to the obedient (D&C 108:1-3).

item.title: Priesthood Keys Restored in Kirtland Temple
item.description: In a glorious vision the priesthood keys were restored in the Kirtland Temple (D&C 110:11-16).

item.title: Priesthood Keys Revealed
item.description: Elder Hales teaches how the priesthood keys were revealed (D&C 110:11-16).

item.title: "If They Harden Not Their Hearts"
item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (D&C 112:1-16).

item.title: A Light and Standard to the Nations
item.description: Elder Cook teaches that the gospel is a light and standard to the nations (D&C 115:5-6).

item.title: "When He Falls He Shall Rise Again"
item.description: President Packer teaches about the Lord's counsel to Oliver Granger (D&C 117:12-15).

item.title: Tithing Funds the Lord's Work
item.description: (D&C 119:1-3) Elder Oaks teaches how tithing funds the Lord's work.

item.title: A Standing Law unto the Church
item.description: (D&C 119:3-7) President Hinckley tells a story of a woman who sacrificed to pay tithing.

item.title: The Miracle of Tithing
item.description: (D&C 119:3-7) President Hinckley teaches about the miracle of tithing.

item.title: Watched Over by God: Elizabeth Panting's Journey to Zion
item.description: To join the faithful saints in Zion, Mary Panting fled her abusive husband and traveled from England to Salt Lake City with her children. Her journey was filled with difficult hardships, but also many miracles.

item.title: Endowed with Power
item.description: A dramatization of President Brigham Young speaking about the Saints receiving temple ordinances before leaving Nauvoo. President Howard W. Hunter and others speak of the blessing of participating in temple ordinances.

item.title: The Dead Awaited the Atonement
item.description: (D&C 138:18-37) Elder Nelson teaches that the dead waited the Atonement.

item.title: Righteous Desires
item.description: (D&C 137:5-10) Elder Maxwell teaches about righteous desires.

item.title: Tried in All Things
item.description: (D&C 136:29-33) Elder Maxwell explains how the Saints will be tried in all things.

item.title: Joseph Smith—Prophet of the Restoration
item.description: (D&C 135) This review of the Prophet Joseph Smith's ministry shows that he "has done more, save Jesus only, for the salvation of men in this world."

item.title: Temples Bless the Living and the Dead
item.description: (D&C 124:38-41) Temples bless the living and the dead.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Smith: Tutored by Heaven
item.description: Joseph was taught by God the Father, Jesus Christ, and other heavenly messengers the gospel that he was to share with the world. (D&C 128)

item.title: Haun's Mill
item.description: President Eyring narrates a video portraying the events at Haun's Mill (D&C 121).
